revised_title: Experimental Determination of Attractive Forces between Mica Cylinders
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to measure macroscopic attractive forces between two mica cylinders using the dynamic-jump and static-jump methods. The dynamic-jump method allows for the direct measurement of attractive forces for distances of separation below the static-jump distance, down to a separation very close to the contact point of the surfaces. This method provides insights into the static-jump method and offers potential for measuring forces in smaller distances of separation.
